page.title: 15BRITISH SALT. (B.S.)
page.content: {B.S.}was founded in 1965, by{Staveley {Industries P.L.C.}Building began on 1st. Jan. 1968 and ended on 25th. June 1969,{B.S.}covers 23 acres of land, the actual factory buildings cover 17 acres. It is the sole factory, and the largest salt producer in the world. 231 people are employed at B.S,155, working on the actual product, and 58 people in the offices. Salt is mined from nearby Warmingham, and is brought by pipeline to{B.S.}2,550 tonnes of salt are mined every day.{B.S. produces white salt only. The product is purchased direct from the factory. It is transported either in bags on lorries, or in one of the 28 tankers,to firms all over Great Britain. A conveyor belt takes salt to the factory next door,{R.H.M.}to be processed for the retail market.
